metadata.name: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Using Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using the PowerShell Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('get-localgroupmember ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('domain admins')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' administrator')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' administrateur')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('enterprise admins')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('exchange trusted subsystem')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('remote desktop users')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('utilisateurs du bureau à distance')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('usuarios de escritorio remoto'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using the PowerShell Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: Administrative activity Reference: https://www.absolomb.com/2018-01-26-Windows-Privilege-Escalation-Guide/
